lead_paragraph: Officials in 11 states, led by Texas, accused the federal government of trying to make schools and offices “laboratories for a massive social experiment.”

byline.contributor: David Montgomery reported from Austin, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta. Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York, Manny Fernandez from Houston, and Eric Lichtblau from Washington.
byline.original: By DAVID MONTGOMERY and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: States File Suit in Test of Administration’s Transgender Bathroom Policy
headline.main: States Sue Obama Administration Over Transgender Bathroom Policy

snippet: Officials in 11 states, led by Texas, accused the federal government of trying to make schools and offices “laboratories for a massive social experiment.”
abstract: Officials from 11 states file lawsuit challenging Obama administration's guidance on civil rights of transgender students enrolled in public schools; suit contributes to rapidly moving debate on rights of transgender people and whether executive branch is exceeding its authority and current scope of discrimination laws.
